description: Application under Section 73 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 to carry out development without compliance with  Condition 3 (maximum number of children), and Condition 6 ( Travel Plan) of Planning Permission 20/00985/FUL (Variation of Condition 1 (Commencement of Use) and Condition 5 (Travel Plan) of Planning Permission 18/00159/FUL (Variation of Condition 2 (Number of Children) and Condition 3 (Opening Hours) of Planning Permission 00/04222/FUL (relaxation of Condition 1 of R13514)) to increase the number of children to 70 and extend the hours of operation 7.30 am to 6.30pm) for revised period of use.) to allow for changes to increase the number of children attending the premises at any on time from 70 to 95 and to update the Travel Plan.
decision_conditions: The use hereby permitted shall be commenced within 3 years from the date of planning permission 18/00159/FULReason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act, 1990. (As amended).

The number of children attending the premises at any one time shall not exceed 95.Reason: In order to protect the character and amenity of the area and accord with policy DM10 (Design requirements for new developments (including house extensions) of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The D1 nursery use hereby permitted shall not be in use before 7.30 am or after 6.30pm Monday to Friday or at any time on Saturdays, Sundays or Bank Holidays.Reason: To safeguard the amenities of the occupiers of the neighbouring properties in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

Notwithstanding the provisions of Section 55 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 the premises shall be used only as D1 nursery and for no other use within Class D1 of the Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987, or succeeding legislation.Reason: To ensure that the functioning of the development is satisfactory and tosafeguard the amenities of adjoining occupiers in accordance with Policy DM1 0 (DesignRequirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The use hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the submitted Travel Plan dated April 2021 prepared by Paul Mew Associates.Reason: In order to ensure highway safety and mitigate congestion on the highway and allow the Local Planning Authority to monitor the impacts of the use on the highway network and safety and the amenities of the area and accord with policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the Council's adopted LDF Core Strategy April 2012.
